io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.stock

Class DefaultStock

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.stock.AbstractStock
      • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.stock.DefaultStock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stock, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<AbstractStock>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultOwnedStock

    @ThreadSafe
public class DefaultStock
extends AbstractStock
    Basic stock object with a range of fields that are filled by data from a StockDownloader class. The values of the various fields start out as null until a command is issued to download data and set their values for the first time.

    THREAD SAFETY: This class is MOSTLY thread safe. To clarify, all state fields in this class are guarded by this class's intrinsic lock. The setStockDetails() method is synchronized, as are all the private setter methods it calls on (those setters are only available to be called on by that method, so all the fields can only be altered by a call to that method). All but two of the fields are immutable objects and can be safely published through the getter methods, but the getters are synchronized as well to avoid memory consistency issues. The two non-immutable object fields have copies of their value returned by their respective getters.

    getStockHistory() and getModifiableValueMap() (and its final counterpart from the superclass, getValueMap()) are not directly synchronized. However, the value map is created by calling on the various getters, all of which are synchronized, so access to the fields is still guarded by the lock. Meanwhile, the stock history is created without calling upon any mutable state variables, and therefore offers no risk to the object's state or memory consistency, and can be invoked without needing synchronization.

    HOWEVER, the one potential hole in this class's thread safety lies in the StockDownloader. The thread safety of the downloader object could ultimately compromise the thread safety of this class. When using this class in a multi-threaded environment, always ensure that the downloader class being used is thread safe, and if it isn't then take appropriate measures to compensate.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    StockDownloader, Serialized Form

      • DefaultStock

        public DefaultStock(Stock stock)
        Copy constructor for DefaultStock. Creates a deep copy of the stock parameter.

        NOTE: This does NOT guarantee that all fields of this class will have a value. Whether a field will have a value or be null is determined entirely by whether is has a value or is null in the stock parameter being copied.

        Parameters:
        stock - the stock to copy to this class.

    • Method Detail

      • setStockDetails

        public void setStockDetails(StockDownloader downloader,
                            boolean fullDetails)
                     throws InvalidStockException,
                            java.net.UnknownHostException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Stock
        Download the details of this stock. The values retrieved should be set as fields in this class.

        The boolean fullDetails parameter should be kept constant with the getValueMap() method of this class. That is to say that when this parameter is false, the same subset of fields is used in both of these methods.

        The list of fields to download passed to the StockDownloader object should be based on constant properties the downloader will recognize. The public fields provided here are mean to fulfill this purpose.

        Specified by:
        setStockDetails in interface Stock
        Specified by:
        setStockDetails in class AbstractStock
        Parameters:
        downloader - the StockDownloader utility to get this stock's values.
        fullDetails - if true, downloads the values for all the stock's fields. If false, only downloads a limited set of values for a "quick-view".
        Throws:
        InvalidStockException - if this stock is not a valid stock on the New York Stock Exchange.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the web server to download stock details, most likely due to lack of an internet connection.
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while trying to download and parse the stock details.
        See Also:
        StockDownloader

      • getStockHistory

        public java.util.List<HistoricalQuote> getStockHistory(StockDownloader downloader,
                                                       int months)
                                                throws InvalidStockException,
                                                       java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                                       java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Stock
        Download and get a list of HistoricalQuotes defining the recent history of this stock. Useful for long term analysis of trends and the generation of charts.
        Specified by:
        getStockHistory in interface Stock
        Overrides:
        getStockHistory in class AbstractStock
        Parameters:
        downloader - the StockDownloader utility to get this stock's values from the internet.
        months - the number of months to get a history for.
        Returns:
        a list of HistoricalQuotes for the period requested.
        Throws:
        InvalidStockException - if this stock is not a valid stock on the New York Stock Exchange.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the web server to download stock details, most likely due to lack of an internet connection.
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while trying to download and parse the stock details.
        See Also:
        StockDownloader

        protected void setChangeToday(java.math.BigDecimal changeToday)
        Sets the change today field. This method is protected to allow this class and subclasses an internal tool to change this value. Other classes should rely on setStockDetails(StockDownloader,boolean) to update this stock.
        Parameters:

      • getCurrentPrice

        public java.math.BigDecimal getCurrentPrice()
        Description copied from interface: Stock
        Gets the current price of a share of the stock. This is they key measurement, more than any other, of a stock's current value.

        This method is to be implemented based on how the downloaded value is stored in the class.

        Returns:
        the current price of a share of the stock.

      • getModifiableValueMap

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getModifiableValueMap(boolean fullDetails)
        Description copied from class: AbstractStock
        Returns a modifiable Map of all the values contained in this stock, as opposed to getValueMap() which returns an unmodifiable Map. This method should be the one overriden and configured with the necessary values, as it is invoked when getValueMap is called.

        This method should always ONLY return a modifiable Map, to later be wrapped in an unmodifiable Map. This allows further subclasses to continue to override this method to add additional values to the Map without having to worry about Map immutability.

        Specified by:
        getModifiableValueMap in class AbstractStock
        Parameters:
        fullDetails - whether or not the Map should contain all the values of this stock.
        Returns:
        a Map of the values of this stock.
        See Also:
        AbstractStock.getValueMap()
